Published tasting nited: Excellent structure and sweetness, bright articulated acidity
Other Notable Info: Buena Vista Lot 1, maybe under extracted since it should be brewed at 210 https://youtu.be/XSjoErFkniY
Alex Opinion: Consistent, non flawed, clean, brightens, refreshing and appetizing, goes well with butter jam toast. But a bit thin, no identifiable fruit flavor.
Alex Tasting Notes: Sour, pear skin, a bit thin
Rebby opinion: This coffee is kind of disappointing. I can appreciate how it lacks bitterness/faults and taste quite light. However, I feel that it lacks fruity flavor which i love.
Rebby Tasting: Water & very subtle flavors of ash, chocolate, not bitter
Todays Notes: Sitting on the couch on a lazy Sunday. Alex is eating jam and butter toast - he is gearing up to go on a 8 mile run since he's training for a half marathon. Rebby is finishing an excellent week of vacation and looking forward to one last lazy day of reading and closet organization.

Published tasting nited: crème brûlée, toffee, candied citrus, caramel noted finish
Alex Opinion: Nice light medium roast, would be good as espresso, variation on a familiar coffee
Alex Tasting Notes: Oolong, full bodied, Long finish, toasted brown rice
Rebby opinion: Overall I like this coffee. It's not as light as I normally like, but I enjoy the roundness of the flavor, especially how tart it is.
Rebby Tasting: Well rounded, tart and sweet, raspberry, toast
Todays Notes: We're waking up after Courtney and martins wedding at the chabot space and science center! Grace and Sophie were in town but we got then sunburned and too drunk (respectively). Oops! Today is cloudy. We're having a relaxed morning before race training

Alex Opinion: Nicely balanced medium roast, darker than I'd like, not very fruited. quite sour and flavor stays in the mouth quite strong. tastes like an elevation of familiar coffee
Alex Tasting Notes: Light pomelo, puckery sourness, sumac, toasted wheat
Rebby opinion: Tastes medium dark, like reminiscent of the free coffee at a Hampton inn and suites, Some nice caramel, dark, a little burnt, only slightly bitter
Rebby Tasting: Caramel, sweet, burnt aftertaste
Todays Notes: Purchased coffee yesterday at ferry building farmers market. A sando was 20 dollars, what a world. Enjoyed a hot sf day and sunburned my scalp slightly. Today, alex is going for a half marathon practice run with carson, Rebs is meeting Elena for acai bowls.

Published tasting nited: Buttery and bright. Peach blossom and sticky sweet honey.
Alex Opinion: Really nice breadth of flavors, I like it a lot, it hits at the beginning with fruity, then comes through with a spicy, then finishes with a latent fruit oil.
Alex Tasting Notes: First taste is almost like a dulce de Leche, almost like a cardamum and clove, and then finish pomelo skin (sour bitter pithy).
Rebby opinion: Got a lot better as it cooled. First sip was a six. Not full bodied but pretty balanced. Wish it were a bit fruitier, keeping it out of the top. Umami vibe. Truly a 7.5 rounding to 7
Rebby Tasting: Lemon tart, milk chocolate, fresh
Todays Notes: Rebecca laughted because alex used the term "latent fruit oil" like a fancy boy and alex said "keep writing the shit down!!" Alex was sick this week and spread it to Rebecca who is now sick over the weekend and pissed. He also has been snoring loudly and Rebby had to sleep on the couch twice!!! Alex says Rebby is doing an "Alex dunk fest"

Published tasting nited: creamy, dried blackcurrant, banana-bread, nutty finish
Alex Opinion: I like it a lot. This is a really nice example of what I assume is some alternative process because it has a funky post fermented flavor. Very exciting and easy to appreciate the difference/contrast here
Alex Tasting Notes: Orange marmalade, red velvet cake, banana cream
Rebby opinion: Truly 8.5. I like it a lot especially after it's cooled down. Super light. Sweet but I can't put my finger on it. Negatives are that it's not that fruity, a little watery
Rebby Tasting: Carmel and buttery, strawberry shortcake, light! Slightly watery
Todays Notes: Today we're recovering from our trail races, a little bit sore but generally doing well! Friday we went to a Seder dinner at Meghan and Perry's which was great. After coffee, I'm heading to Pearl spa and sushi and alex is going to meet Barbara.

Alex Opinion: Good, surprisingly un-sweet. Without much fruit flavor. The after taste is kind of bitter and herbaceous. Super unique.
Alex Tasting Notes: Grape leaves, sumac, pickling spice
Rebby opinion: Mixed feelings. Upfront flavor is pretty, round and full. I like the tartness. Not fruity enough for my taste, finish is somewhat bitter and thin. Generally tastes good and high quality, not particularly my taste.
Rebby Tasting: Tart cherry, pomegranate, vanilla, black pepper
Todays Notes: Sitting on couch, 9:49am, drinking and talking for hours with the neighbors last night, Alex is a bit hungover and farting af, will be sent to good life to toot there. Went to sf film fest yesterday and saw children of the mist, about hmong child marriage.

Published tasting nited: Japanese barley tea, honeydew melon, pistachio nougat, black seseme brittle
Alex Opinion: IMO im having a nice time drinking this. Unexpectedly mild for robusta. Kind of interesting to chase the dry process flavor through this. Not something I would seek out by itself. Rebby was right we shouldn't buy a bag.
Alex Tasting Notes: Tastes like robusta but it also has redeeming qualities. Kind of a chai clove flavor. Cedar bark. There is a rindy flavor that could be considered as fruit!
Rebby opinion: Tastes mostly like cheap dark roast coffee, argree wifh barista that it tastes like instant coffee. Maybr only slightly better. I would drink it and be fine, but if i was trying to identify good tastes, this isnt it. 7/11 coffee.
Rebby Tasting: Burnt, acidic sour, caramel
Todays Notes: San Jose day! Alex planned a day for us in San Jose - coffee, car wash, Vietnamese food, and a brewery! Rebecca is wearing a skirt and is very happy in the sun. There's a big Moany dog at the coffee shop

Alex Opinion: It's fine, it's not super exciting. A very sophisticated coffee taster might be able to tease out some flavors, to me it's quite subtle. Maybe would be better with a little oat milk.
Alex Tasting Notes: Sour yogurt, blueberry musk, black tea, acrid
Rebby opinion: overall tastes too bitter and burned for me, in some ways has a kinda balanced flavor. aftertaste is very bitter. almost seems like a bad batch of a decent coffee, can tatse that its not just a super dark roast. has a balanced although not fruity or fine first taste, but turns off twoards the finish.
Rebby Tasting: scortched earth, tree bark, touch of honey
Todays Notes: Drinking the coffee in bed, about to go on a bike ride in Sonoma! Found a 22 mile loop and the weather should be in the 70s

Alex Opinion: Consistent and pleasant. "Pretty much what I expected". Successfully avoided over roasted taste of second wave coffee while missing out on fruited/floral flavors that I would come to expect. Absolutely drinkable but in a different league of stuff we've been tasting.
Alex Tasting Notes: Cucumber water, very mild, whole wheat graham cracker
Rebby opinion: I'm sad, i feel like they gave us the wrong one, it doesn't taste like a light roast it tastes like a dark roast. Very mild pleasant flavor, but bitter aftertaste. Maybe if i had it compared to am actual dark coffee i would like it better, it might be too hot. After cooling I get more caramel and sweetness, bump from a 4 to a 5
Rebby Tasting: Dirt, drip of caramel in the dirt, some tartness and cherry after cooling
Todays Notes: In the car on the way to camping at Kirby Cove. Yesterday we went to Chinatown with Kiana and Swati and then got alex an orange jacket

Alex Opinion: Far better than expected, maybe it's fresh, expected overwhelmingly bitter and ashy. It's lighter and more sour and drinkable than expected.
Alex Tasting Notes: Roasted barkamulch, fresh woody flavor, slightly soapy note, a little sour
Rebby opinion: Slightly worse than I expected. Definitely drinkable/FINE but the most notable flavors are the burnt earth and dry aftertaste. When I swish it around my mouth I get some pleasant fruity and tart flavors which are surprising
Rebby Tasting: Burnt, key lime pie, dry aftertaste

Published tasting nited: Flowers and rainbow sHerbert, sticky brown sugar sweetness
Alex Opinion: I like it a lot. Agree with Rebby that it's more an absence of issues than a stand out. Sourness and funk are some of my favorite parts of natural roast coffee. Better extraction might reveal more subtle flavors.
Alex Tasting Notes: Super sour, vitamin c pills, lemons sHerbert, aftertaste of Pennies
Rebby opinion: I like it, first actual light roast in a while. Not as fruity as i would like but pleasant with a mild bitter aftertaste, nothing as bitter as the other ther coffees weve had recently. Lacks flaws more than is exciting.
Rebby Tasting: Swissmiss, apple, honey, tiny bit of chalk
Todays Notes: Sitting around the house, doing some chores, going ti head over to west side for Emily's birthday this afternoon. Its supposed to be incredibly windy. Had a big pizza fest last night.

Alex Opinion: Really great coffee despite it being a decaf. The kind of decaf I would like after dinner. Not enough fruity exciting flavor, but technically flawless. That it's decaf is pretty impressive.
Alex Tasting Notes: Miso, Marcona almonds, savory
Rebby opinion: Its not bad, doesnt have many flaws. Lacks fruity and tart flavors i like, a little bit flat
Rebby Tasting: Butter, orange rind, mud
Todays Notes: Rebs is still testing positive but feeling much better generally!! Big improvement from last week for sure. Its a nuce day in the back yard and nacho the dog is here charming alex and Rebby. Freddy is going ape and pissing rebs off

Alex Opinion: I like it quite a bit. Hard to put my finger on, but rich with a depth of flavor. It has a bitterness that is kinda like the bitterness of the cricket snacks.
Alex Tasting Notes: Mulling spice, seawater salt, pomelo pith, kinda mineral
Rebby opinion: Uhhhhm. Theres nothing wring woth this coffee but im not finding it very exviting. Having trouble pulling out tge flavors. Its very light but also a litte bit flat.
Rebby Tasting: Grapes, simple syrup, earthy, and a little watery

Alex Opinion: Really pleasant. Feels kinda thin but consistently flavored. Limited sour/tangy-ness, much richer and more chocolatey, more body. I like a nice surprise.
Alex Tasting Notes: Hazelnuts, Greek yogurt, sweet soy sauce
Rebby opinion: I like this a lot, I think it's a good mix of sweet tart and rich-ness. It's comforting but also interesting. It's not my typical style of coffee but I like it.
Rebby Tasting: Caramel apple, chocolate chips, buttery steak
Todays Notes: Rebecca says we have to get our lives in order this weekend - figure out Ecuador travel, clean the house, voting, etc!!

Alex Opinion: Big disclaimer: Alex has corona. I think I'm missing some of the flavor, I get a lot of the delicious sour front end but then it falls off and is watery. Still rich in the mouth and still super bright, wish I could taste and smell more of the floral bouncy stuff and want to try again later
Alex Tasting Notes: Tangerines and cuties, pomplemouse la croix, cinnamon bark
Rebby opinion: Good, but notnquite as good as i was expecting. I dont think this js their best batch much better now that its cooled. Pretty flawless and has some good flavors, but missing some of the wow factors i was expecting. Getting better the more i have of it.
Rebby Tasting: Floral, orange, touch of caramel,

Coffee Producer: Allona Farm, Guji highland coffee plantation (GHCP)
Alex Opinion: It's weird how it has a Smokey bitter flavor that stays in your mouth (pleasant) which I don't associate with light roast coffee. I guess that's supposed to be full body. It's excellent, I wish it were fruitier but that's just a preference thing.
Alex Tasting Notes: Fire roasted vegetables (carrots and broccolini over a grill), tartness, pleasant lasting bitterness
Rebby opinion: Drinking it cooler, so advantaged. Low on bitterness and burnt flavora. Not particularly fruity. Still tastes light somehow. No major flaws, i think its pretty good! Better than expected.
Rebby Tasting: Malty, caramel, tomato soup

Alex Opinion: Really nice, really light, complete, no wince anywhere in the taste
Alex Tasting Notes: Bosque pear, sesame hazelnut spread, sweet
Rebby opinion: I dont feel like my tasting senses are super sharp today. Its not thatttt ,fruity but it has other pleasant flavors, very light not bitter not burnt. First coffee in a while with no flaws and quite good flavors
Rebby Tasting: Hazelnut, grape, cream

Alex Opinion: It is great. It's super super big mouth feel. Almost waxy flavor that lingers. Probably just the power of suggestion but it does have a kinda tropicalness to it. I don't get as much fruit flavor as when it was brewed there.
Alex Tasting Notes: Ginger snaps, molasses, toasted pecans
Rebby opinion: I like it but dont love it, to me there is a kinda coffee dreg taste happening. I like the tartness, its not watery.
Rebby Tasting: Bell Peppers, tart, a little bit earthy

Alex Opinion: Fantastic, richand tasfy and more flavors Thani can taste
Alex Tasting Notes: Clover honey, lemon juice, sour miso
Rebby opinion: Berry good, a little unusual, very tangy and sour. I think i mad eit a little to watery (technical difficulty) i feel like it would be a nine if it wasnt watery but its an 8.5
Rebby Tasting: Tangy skinny a little watery keylime
Todays Notes: Sonia, Martin, Theo, Hanna, and Jordan are all in town! Had a big brunch and brewed the Fankor coffee for everyone

Alex Opinion: Much more floral and herbal than fruity. Super delicious and tastes a bit sophisticated. Truly excellent. Strong 8.
Alex Tasting Notes: Rose hips, hibiscus, cinnamon, brown sugar, Brie
Rebby opinion: Really nice, balanced, slight off flavor in the aftertaste. Not feeling very creative in my flavors today.
Rebby Tasting: Chocolate, pineapple, floral
Todays Notes: Today we're getting our lives in order - cleaning the house, budgeting, making bread, etc etc. Yesterday we went to the pleasant hill library opening

Published tasting nited: black grape, dark chocolate, cane sugar
Alex Opinion: This coffee has no obvious faults, I like that it's fairly full bodied, but it lacks any sort of punchy flavor or wow factor. Balanced and tasty coffee.
Alex Tasting Notes: Very strong black tea, watermelon, low in acid,
Rebby opinion: Not as horrible as my tasting notes make it sound. But a little bit too earthy and bitter for me when I'm looking for tart and fruity. No major flaws, but the aftertaste is very astringent.
Rebby Tasting: Tree bark, ash, little bit of honey, little bit bitter,

Published tasting nited: Sweet - Savory - Praline - Citrus - Oolong Tea
Alex Opinion: Incredibly savory. Rich with lots of depth. Improved after cooling down. Creamy.
Alex Tasting Notes: Yogurt and granola. Black trumpet mushrooms. Japanese dashi. 100% chocolate
Rebby opinion: Pretty good, at first i thouggt it tasted watery. pHas almost a creamy sensatuon, full bodied, not bitter
Rebby Tasting: Hot chocolate, orange peel, fall vibes, earthy

Alex Opinion: One of the most mouth filling coffees. A lot of mass. A lot of flavor coming out of the low end, less of a fruit/floral nose. Very tasty coffee nonetheless.
Alex Tasting Notes: Stewed vegetable sweetness. Pear skin. A little bit of stewed cherry.
Rebby opinion: Its a good coffee for a gray chilly day, a winter day. Its comforting, not sure excitibg but its easy to drink.
Rebby Tasting: Im having trouble describing this coffee, kinda tastes like red wine with a little bit of sweetness and tartness. Almost reminds me of a Christmas roast beef. Rich and full, less fruity and floral

Alex Opinion: This coffee has so much going on - rich flavor, really complex, it still has a distinct coffee bitterness. But it's so blended and mixed with strong flavor so I kinda like it.
Alex Tasting Notes: Preserves, cantaloupe, molasses, soapy body
Rebby opinion: when you really pay attention, its quite sweet and fruity. its not an obvious flavour. its a little darker than most of my favorites. very little bitterness or faults. my only complaint is its a lttle dark, just a preference.
Rebby Tasting: sweet grapes, molasses, pinapple

Published tasting nited: Red plum, black tea, dark chocolate
Alex Opinion: A lot of complexity like 100 year soup stock, kind of overwhelmed by sourness and savory body at this tasting. Still pretty interesting and a complex light roast with some floral black tea
Alex Tasting Notes: Rich mushroom broth, definitely savory, quite sour, almost a marinade
Rebby opinion: I could say its interesting, but its not my favorite. I dont really enjoy the vegetables flavor and it lacks a little bit of acidity. Its a little flat to me. Not boring :\
Rebby Tasting: Vegetable stew, almost a little salty. Maybe a touch of caramel, slightly bitter.
Todays Notes: It's Tuesday and Rebecca is taking a "sick day" aka a valid mental health day from work!! Later today we'll be helping Jules move
